item.title: Pizza-N-Go: A Full-stack Application
item.description: I would admit, the picture above looks delicious, isn’t it ? I like to present the food ordering application I have created to learn Full-stack Web Development. I had general understanding of the web application and how they are built, but I always wanted to build one from ground up with some of the advance features like real time communication using Web Sockets, user Sessions and Cookie management, integrating text message API, asynchronous operations and more.

item.title: Interview-Scheduler: A React application
item.description: React scheduler with up to five appointments per day. The information will be synced over multiple clients with the help of Web Sockets. Final Product Opening page Landing page, with up to five appointments per day and dynamic counter for the remaining spots. Creating a new appointment Allows the creation (or edition) of an appointment, by entering the name and selecting the interviewer. Contextual warnings and Error handling Warns the user if name field was left empty.

item.title: Job-Comparator: An Android Application
item.description: Introduction Job Comparison App is an Android mobile app which allows a user to compare job offers using customizable settings. System requirements Job Comparison App requires Android version 10 (Android Q) and Pixel 4 XL. Features and functionalities Main menu When the app starts, a main menu is displayed and it allows the user to choose one of the four options: Enter or edit current job details Enter job offers Adjust the comparison settings Compare job offers (enabled if there are 2 or more jobs).
